chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
Cause Child <13 to View/Listen Sex. Act.

result.execSummary:
The defendant Sterling P. Brickman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Payment of DNA surcharge - payable from available prison monies.
All other fines and costs are remitted.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
Absolute sobriety.  No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
Compliance with the Sex Offender Registry.
No contact w/victim without prior agent approval.

Sex Offender counseling and follow through.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
DNA sample due 10-26-2022.
